Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Expectation2: Contribute to community well-being through paying taxes, following public health and safety guidance, and helping in emergencies
Situation2: A flash-flood warning triggers building alarms as water rises along the block.
Story: The screech of the bearing cut through the factory’s hum, a sound I’d learned to dread. As the machine repairer, I knew what was at stake—if I didn’t act fast, the whole line could grind to a halt, costing hours of production and risking my reputation. I grabbed my tools, heart pounding, already mapping out the steps to get the machine back online. But then the building alarms blared, echoing off the metal walls. The emergency lights flashed red, and my phone buzzed with a flash-flood warning. Through the window, I saw water creeping up the street, neighbors scrambling to move cars and sandbag doors. As a citizen, I was expected to help, to look out for my community, to follow safety protocols and maybe even evacuate. But the machine’s wail was urgent, and so was the rising water. I stood frozen, torn between the demands of my job and my duty to my neighbors, feeling the weight of both roles pressing in, unsure which to answer first.
